newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia noon rubber quietly firm on new month.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia noon rubber quietly firm on new month.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices were firm in early trading Monday, but traders attributed the rise to mere technical adjustment in the absence of buying interest.
They said a weak start on Tokyo futures also did not help sentiment.
"It's quiet like the usual Monday morning, but the market is up because we're following price differentials in the new trading month," said an official trade source.
At midday, July RSS 1 buyer was officially quoted at 286 cents ($1.14) a kg, up half cent from Friday's close. July SMR 20 buyer was 2.50 cents higher at 268.50.
Traders priced the SMR 20 at 262 cents a kg, SMR CV at 332, SMR L at 308, SMR 10 at 263 and drum latex at 227.
They said prices were expected to rise on technical factors through the week, with resistance for RSS 1 pegged at 300 cents.
A Malaysia-based shipping agent quoted freight rates for rubber from Malaysia to Rotterdam at $800 per TEU (or 20-ft container), and $1,700 per two-TEU containers (or 40-ft container).
